title: Cryptomultiplier
author: Cryptomultiplier
content: A lot of apps now exist with preference for users from beginner or pro features to rewards/bonuses. Like music apps, chat apps, gaming apps, gambling apps, graphics and photo design apps. The designs and services is different from creation or same for those offering similar service  with only slight adaptations, like the boom player and Spotify music apps which serve same purpose, but with different designs adapted to suit a users device and preference.The thing now is this, upon using any one of these recent apps, a time always come when the most interesting features get restricted to only premium subscription users.  Where no subscription is made, the user is limited in the use of the app and is bombarded with lots of advert pop ups.Am curious to know, is there some notable app(s) created for whatever purposes which has a premium subscription payment plan for any of its package and accepts or allows crypto or BTC payments for the package?

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptomultiplier on September 19, 2023, 06:33:51 PMAm curious to know, is there some notable app(s) created for whatever purposes which has a premium subscription payment plan for any of its package and accepts or allows crypto or BTC payments for the package?I am only aware of VPN services that one can pay with crypto like bitcoin. This service is somewhat related to crypto cause it is privacy related and the owners of the service assumes that crypto users will heavily patronize their service.Services which are unrelated to crypto like music streaming apps or randome games will not be interested to open a crypto payment option.

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Hmm, not familiar with many of such applications but I do remember that one of the most used and famous services provided by the Internet Download Manager in my region for which I'm familiar from a reasonable timespan, IDM offers its subscription purchase through the BTC. For more, I think in almost all digital-casinos BTC is accepted as a payment mode.Moreover, I'm familiar with a couple of third-party services that provide OTT platform subscriptions in the BTC, also a couple of VPNs (Nord, Ghost) also do offer their subscription to be paid with BTC. Even though now here the third-party premium tools providers as well accept BTC. Its really not concerning nowadays. When a big fish is handy in the game then it might gain some hype for the rest of the application I think it really doesn't matter if they allow BTC as their payment mode not. In social media apps to provide their services, they need to follow the policies of the state/government. Just imagine in the gaming industry GTA-6 officially recognizing the BTC and their game premium currency for special events.

comments.author: salad daging
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptomultiplier on September 19, 2023, 06:33:51 PMAm curious to know, is there some notable app(s) created for whatever purposes which has a premium subscription payment plan for any of its package and accepts or allows crypto or BTC payments for the package?Like the application you mentioned with the premium application does not seem to accept payments using crypto / BTC they only accept fiat or credit cards that I know of.What I have done in purchasing on a site using BTC is buying a VPN and VPS that provides BTC payment services, but for everything else I have never done.If there is an offer like that then I would like to buy a premium subscription to sports broadcasts, but if it uses a third party I have never done it.

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: There are not many places where you can spend BTC as a mode of payment due to government regulation but if you can see a gift card payment option on any app then you can simply use BTC to buy the gift card on a platform like Bitrefil and then use the gift card as payment to buy a premium subscription.Take a look at Where to spend Bitcoin? by Ratimov to know where you can use crypto for getting services and many other stuff.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptomultiplier on September 19, 2023, 06:33:51 PMAm curious to know, is there some notable app(s) created for whatever purposes which has a premium subscription payment plan for any of its package and accepts or allows crypto or BTC payments for the package?Unfortunately for most of the application we can't avail the premium subscription with Bitcoin payments. The reason is that most of the applications are available on either Google PlayStore or Apple AppStore and both of those don't really accept Bitcoin payments. The only best way to avail the premium features of those applications with the help of BTC payments is to purchase Apple gift cards or Google Play gift cards with the help of Bitcoin payments. That's the best way to unlock those premium features with the help of Bitcoin payments.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: On the same topic, I have a proposal. What if we all start hitting up app developers whenever we fancy upgrading to their premium versions and ask them to accept Bitcoin payments? I believe this could contribute to the wider adoption of cryptocurrency for everyday transactions. It's a small step, but every little bit helps! If developers get a bunch of Bitcoin requests, they might consider adding it as a payment option, making it more accessible to users. Worth a shot, right?

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: decodx on September 19, 2023, 09:59:22 PMOn the same topic, I have a proposal. What if we all start hitting up app developers whenever we fancy upgrading to their premium versions and ask them to accept Bitcoin payments? Maybe this has to do with the Play Store policy. They also need to set up a payment processor which can add more fees, and even if they decide to use open-source software they still need to weigh the cost and time to do that. I do use stores that accept crypto, although most of them are marketplace and not an app. Some games that are not listed on the Play Store also accept crypto. Based on this I believe the key reason why not all apps accept BTC or crypto is simply because the profit is not that much for them, hence why there is no incentive to do so. CMIIW.

comments.author: Beerwizzard

comments.author: KiaKia
comments.body: I've use BTC to pay for VPS services and also VPN few times before and if you are looking for more you should get bit refill app on your phone, you can buy many things through this app, from gift cards to airtimes and even pay your bills like electricity bills and other. I've also use this app to get eSIM, they Algeria, Australia and also Global too, they have access to cool hotel offers, like bonus offers, I don't think anything matches the level of this app, they accept BTC, USDT, and some other altcoins too. Most VPN services now have crypto payment options and I believe in time many other services will start accepting Bitcoin and others too, it's a slow but steady journey, we will get there some day.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Part of these services accept payment in Bitcoin directly, such as hosting service providers, VPNs, or freelancing platforms, or through Bitcoin payment services, whether direct, such as btcpayserver, or indirectly, such as cards that are charged with Bitcoin, such as Binance Pay. Indirect methods can include purchasing gift cards or postpaid cards, or paying a third party to conduct the transaction for you.

comments.author: Blitzboy
comments.body: First, many of these apps are actually very aggressive in the way they work. They lure people in with cool features, but just as you're getting used to them, they change the rules and make you pay or deal with a lot of ads. They make money off of our FOMOWhat you really want to know is how apps that accept cryptocurrency work. A lot of sites now accept Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies since they have become more popular. One company that lets you put Bitcoin into your Microsoft account is Microsoft. Even though this isnt an app itself, it shows that big companies are taking cryptocurrency. Services like ExpressVPN and NordVPN accept Bitcoin payments. VPNs arent exactly fun music or game apps, but they do work with Bitcoin.But the mainstream app business has been slow to adopt cryptocurrency because it is volatile and there are problems with how it is regulated. But as the world changes slowly, you can expect more apps to follow suit.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: KiaKia on September 20, 2023, 11:00:13 AMI've also use this app to get eSIM, they Algeria, Australia and also Global too, they have access to cool hotel offers, like bonus offers, I don't think anything matches the level of this app, they accept BTC, USDT, and some other altcoins too. I don't think OP is referring to a service like Bitrefill. Judging from how he asks if there is any app that offers a subscription with BTC, OP is looking for a service like Spotify that accepts BTC. I do agree that he probably needs to expand his target if he wants to spend or use his BTC.VPN service by nature is quite friendly with crypto since using fiat can expose the user info (which is probably a negative thing for most of their customers). While other services are starting to accept BTC, most of them also require KYC aggressively.

comments.body: Quote from: jrrsparkles on September 19, 2023, 08:33:25 PMTake a look at Where to spend Bitcoin? by Ratimov to know where you can use crypto for getting services and many other stuff.If you can pay directly through bitcoin, it is good and convenient but even you can not, it's not the end of the world. You can sell your bitcoin and use fiat currency to pay those services. I don't think it is too much different from on chain transaction fee, trading fee. It will require some additional fee but not too much.The thread by Ratimov is a big one but after some years, it needs to have update as I believe some websites are no longer working in 2023.
